title.value: Development of small, cost-efficient scintillating fiber detectors for automated synthesis of positron emission tomography radiopharmaceuticals
title.justification: The title is directly stated in the document, reflecting the research's aim on developing cost-effective detectors.
title.quote: Development of small, cost-efficient scintillating fiber detectors for automated synthesis of positron emission tomography radiopharmaceuticals

extractions.description: The paper focuses on the development of compact and affordable detectors using scintillating fibers and silicon photomultipliers for PET radiopharmaceutical production.

type.justification: The study includes simulations and practical tests involving detector construction and performance evaluation, indicating empirical work.
type.quote: This study aimed to develop a compact and cost-efficient detector... Monte Carlo simulations were performed... two detector configurations... were constructed... Detectors were calibrated using a Fluorine-18 ( ^{18} F) source...

name.justification: The research is centered on enhancing PET imaging through better detector development, clearly fitting into Medical Imaging.
name.quote: Positron emission tomography (PET) imaging relies on the availability of radiopharmaceuticals...

name.justification: The paper discusses the development and optimization of radiation detectors for PET.
name.quote: The key to this automation is the use of radiation detectors... However, the high cost of these detectors has motivated the need for a more affordable alternative.

name.justification: The research is specific to improving technologies within PET setups, involving radiotracer synthesis.
name.quote: enhance the efficiency of PET radiotracer synthesis, leading to broader access to PET imaging.

name.justification: M-TAG is mentioned as the Monte Carlo simulation tool used for evaluating detector efficiencies.
name.quote: Monte Carlo simulations were performed using the Geant4 toolkit and a simulation package called Modular Radiation Teaching-Aid for Geant4 (M-TAG)...

is_contributed.justification: The paper adapts the M-TAG for a specific use but does not develop it.
is_contributed.quote: Monte Carlo simulations were performed using the Geant4 toolkit and a simulation package called Modular Radiation Teaching-Aid for Geant4 (M-TAG)...

is_executed.justification: The M-TAG is a simulation package and does not run on traditional execution platforms like CPU/GPU.
is_executed.quote: Monte Carlo simulations were performed using the Geant4 toolkit and a simulation package called Modular Radiation Teaching-Aid for Geant4 (M-TAG)...

is_compared.justification: The paper does not numerically compare M-TAG with other models as it serves a specific simulation purpose.
is_compared.quote: Monte Carlo simulations were performed using the Geant4 toolkit and a simulation package called Modular Radiation Teaching-Aid for Geant4 (M-TAG)...

referenced_paper_title.value: M-TAG: a modular teaching-aid for Geant4
referenced_paper_title.justification: Likely referenced given the mention of M-TAG as a tool used for simulation.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Monte Carlo simulations were performed using the Geant4 toolkit and a simulation package called Modular Radiation Teaching-Aid for Geant4 (M-TAG)...
